name: mvrcl2
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
-| wi(w0, wf(c0, c4, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c4))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
-| wi(w0, wf(c0, c4, c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c4))

stmt.origin: mvrf(c0, c4, c2, c3, c5, c6, w0)
stmt.pretty: mvrf(c0, c4, c2, c3, c5, c6, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wf(c0, c4, c2))
-| wceq(c3, co(c4, cmps, c5))
-| wceq(c0, co(c4, cmvr, c5))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c6))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c5, crg))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 →(c0 : c4 → c2))
⊣ c3 =(c4[mPwSer]c5)
⊣ c0 =(c4[mVar]c5)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ c6)
⊣ (w0 → c5 ∈ Ring)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c4))
-| wceq(c3, co(c4, cmps, c5))
-| wceq(c0, co(c4, cmvr, c5))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c6))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c5, crg))

comment: A power series variable is an element of the base set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2014.)
